title: SAGE: Sample-Aware Guarding Engine for Robust Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
description: Sample-aware defense engine with active learning for adaptive defense selection.
features: Integrated active learning with targeted data reduction to select optimal defenses against adversarial attacks.
Built two-level defense selection pipeline identifying highly informative samples for meta-learner training.
Achieved 201% F1-score improvement over state-of-the-art defenses with 29× computational cost reduction. Paper under review by IEEE TIFS.

title: CITADEL: Continual Anomaly Detection for Enhanced Learning in IoT Intrusion Detection
description: Self-supervised continual learning framework with memory-aware masked autoencoders for IoT security.
features: Developed self-supervised continual learning framework learning robust benign traffic representations with optimized memory consolidation.
Integrated tabular-to-image transformation and memory-aware MAE enabling anomaly detection without labeled attack data.
Designed novelty detection component adapting to emerging threats while retaining known attack detection, achieving 72.9% improvement over VLAD. Paper under review by IEEE IoTJ.

title: DYNAMITE: Dynamic Defense Selection for Enhancing Machine Learning-based Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
description: Dynamic defense framework with XGBoost classifier for real-time adaptive defense selection.
features: Developed DYNAMITE framework adaptively selecting most effective defenses against diverse adversarial attacks in real-time.
Implemented adversarial attack generation and integrated nine state-of-the-art defenses with XGBoost-based dynamic assignment.
Achieved 76.7% F1-score improvement over random defense with 96.2% computational cost reduction. Best Paper Award at SafeThings 2025.

title: SAFE: Self-Supervised Anomaly Detection Framework for Intrusion Detection
description: Self-supervised anomaly detection transforming tabular traffic into image representations with masked autoencoders.
features: Proposed SAFE framework transforming tabular network traffic into image-like representations for robust feature learning with MAEs.
Developed lightweight novelty detection module leveraging MAE-extracted representations to detect unknown and evolving cyber threats without labeled data.
Achieved 26.2% F1-score improvement over SLAD and 23.5% improvement over Anomal-E across multiple IoT datasets. Accepted by AAAI Workshop on AICS 2025.

title: Rigorous Evaluation of Machine Learning-Based Intrusion Detection Against Adversarial Attacks
description: Comprehensive evaluation framework benchmarking ML-based IoT IDS against white-box, gray-box, and black-box attacks.
features: Developed comprehensive evaluation framework benchmarking ML-based IoT IDS against white-box, gray-box, and black-box adversarial attacks.
Evaluated state-of-the-art ML/DL models across four IoT datasets using gradient-based, optimization-based, and transfer-based attack methods.
Revealed severe vulnerabilities with IDS performance degrading up to 49.5× under adversarial perturbations. Accepted by IEEE CSR 2024.
